metadata.title: CVE-2020-5253 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
NetHack before version 3.6.0 allowed malicious use of escaping of characters in the configuration file (usually .nethackrc) which could be exploited. This bug is patched in NetHack 3.6.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-5253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nethack-common - 3.6.0-4
nethack-console - 3.6.0-4
nethack-qt - 3.6.0-4
nethack-x11 - 3.6.0-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nethack package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-4').
